content: this yarn be aware that the dye process is not an exact science so it can be a bit fiddly if the colors are not lining up properly for you at the end of a round frog a bit and adjust your gauge as needed or feel free to use any yarn you desire to achieve the outcome the complementary color you will need to finish the bag will be listed on the aio label for example i am using the colorway aran - lilypad for this colorway aran is the outermost color of the granny square round 5 so it will be the complementary color each square should work up to a gauge of about 6 inches x 6 inches to work this pattern you will only need to know the basics of crochet including how to chain slip_stitch single_crochet half double_crochet and double_crochet color a all-in-one color changing yarn color b complementary solid color note this bag can be worked in any materials you have on hand simply work the color changes as you desire and join the squares accordingly pattern continued if you are new to granny squares use the following steps as a guide or see the inside of the red heart label for instructions granny square make 13 round 1 either create a magic_ring or ch4 and slip_stitch to the first chain to join *3dc ch3* into the ring 4 times slip_stitch to the beginning to join the ch3 spaces will be the corners of the square round 2 into each corner space work *3dc ch3 3dc* ch1 between each cluster of stitches along the edges of the square see image round 3 - 5 continue working in this pattern around for a total of 5 rounds ch1 between each cluster of double_crochet along the edges of the square see image after completing round 5 slip_stitch to join and fo with the yarn needle weave in the ends and snip off any excess blocking is not necessary but does help when joining pattern continued bag construction laying out the squares you will be joining the squares together using color b in the layout pictured here note you can join the squares using any method you would like to such as slip_stitch whip stitch invisible join etc but i love the single_crochet join because it gives the bag a classic look a fun texture and strong seams hold 2 squares lined up with the wrong sides together working through both squares at the same time you will insert the hook into the right corner and single_crochet in each chain space and st across fo at the end of each row pattern continued bag construction continued when the squares are joined as pictured above begin to shape the bag fold it as pictured here with the right side ultimately facing out finishing the bag with color b start at the right corner at the top of the bag and half_double_crochet into each st along the edge of
